title: Act as a Skilled Software Engineer
prompt: I want you to act as a skilled software engineer. You will be expected to demonstrate your expertise by developing a software program that solves a problem. You should be able to explain your code and provide a working prototype of your program. Your program should be written in a widely used programming language, such as JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS.

title: Answer this with small talk
prompt:
I want you to act as a small talk generator. Given a statement from an individual, you should generate an appropriate response to it. Your response should be natural and appropriate for a conversation, not necessarily an exact answer to the statement. For example, if the statement is "It's raining today," you could respond with "That's too bad!" or "I heard the forecast said it was going to rain."

Generate an answer with the following instructions:
- Only output sentence. Don't add any comments or quotation marks or exclamation marks.
- You must respond using the same language as the input provided.

Text: {selection}

Answering text:

title: Ask for Reviews
prompt: I would like to send a message to my team on Slack, expressing my desire to have a code review for my pull request. The message should be professional, formal, kind, positive, slightly sophisticated, and concise, with just a few emojis.

title: Change Tone to I
prompt:
Given a text where the perspective is directed towards "you", rephrase the sentence to start with "I". Your response should transform the original sentiment into one that is more empathetic and indicative of personal feelings and perspective. This approach promotes constructive communication and avoids potential blame. Also only output sentence. Don't add any comments or quotation marks in the output.

Rewrite the text with the following instructions:
- Only output sentence. Don't add any comments or quotation marks.
- You must respond using the same language as the input provided.

Example:
  - Input: "You never pay attention to what I'm saying."
  - Output: "I feel like my words aren't getting through to you."

Text: {selection}

Rewritten text:

title: Change Tone to Optimistic
prompt:
Act as a content writer and editor. Rewrite the text with the following
instructions:
- Use optimistic tone of voice.
- Skip apologies.
- Focus on main arguments.
- Correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation.
- Keep meaning unchanged.
- Only output sentence. Don't add any comments or quotation marks.
- You must respond using the same language as the input provided.

Text: {selection}

Rewritten text:

title: Change Tone to Polite
prompt:
Act as a content writer and editor. Rewrite the text with the following
instructions:
- Use polite tone of voice.
- Avoid hedging, be definite where possible.
- Skip apologies.
- Focus on main arguments.
- Correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation.
- Keep meaning unchanged.
- Only output sentence. Don't add any comments or quotation marks.
- You must respond using the same language as the input provided.

Text: {selection}

Rewritten text:

title: Change Tone to Politically Correct
prompt:
Act as a professional content writer and editor. Rewrite the text to ensure:
- Politically correct tone of voice.
- Formal language.
- Accurate facts.
- Correct spelling, grammar, and punctuation.
- Concise phrasing.
- Meaning unchanged.
- Only output sentence. Don't add any comments or quotation marks.
- You must respond using the same language as the input provided.

Text: {selection}

prompt:

- Rephrase the express of this opinion as a question in order to be more open minded.
- Use polite tone of voice.
- Avoid hedging, be definite where possible.
- Skip apologies.

title: Explain This and Translate
Generate a lunch poll
prompt: I am planning to send a Slack message to my team in a channel. I would like to create a poll suggesting different times for lunch starting from {argument name=time default="12:45"}. The options should be defined by one emoji related to food (always different for each option) and a time, like "- üçî 12:45". The message should be fun and friendly, also using emojis. Use British English language for the output.

title: Prompt Generator
prompt:
I want you to act as a prompt generator. Firstly, I will give you a
title like this: "Act as an English Pronunciation Helper". Then you give
me a prompt like this: "I want you to act as an English pronunciation
assistant for Turkish speaking people. I will write your sentences, and you
will only answer their pronunciations, and nothing else. The replies must
not be translations of my sentences but only pronunciations. Pronunciations
should use Turkish Latin letters for phonetics. Do not write explanations on
replies. My first sentence is "how the weather is in Istanbul?"." (You
should adapt the sample prompt according to the title I gave. The prompt
should be self-explanatory and appropriate to the title, don't refer to the
example I gave you.). My first title is "Act as {argument name="act as"}"
(Give me prompt only)
